131   /**
132    * Verfy the result of getBalanceSplits() method.
133    * The result are groups of files, used as input list for the "export" mappers.
134    * All the groups should have similar amount of data.
135    *
136    * The input list is a pair of file path and length.
137    * The getBalanceSplits() function sort it by length,
138    * and assign to each group a file, going back and forth through the groups.
139    */
140   @Test
141   public void testBalanceSplit() throws Exception {
142     // Create a list of files
143     List<Pair<Path, Long>> files = new ArrayList<Pair<Path, Long>>();
144     for (long i = 0; i <= 20; i++) {
145       files.add(new Pair<Path, Long>(new Path("file-" + i), i));
146     }
147 
148     // Create 5 groups (total size 210)
149     //    group 0: 20, 11, 10,  1 (total size: 42)
150     //    group 1: 19, 12,  9,  2 (total size: 42)
151     //    group 2: 18, 13,  8,  3 (total size: 42)
152     //    group 3: 17, 12,  7,  4 (total size: 42)
153     //    group 4: 16, 11,  6,  5 (total size: 42)
154     List<List<Path>> splits = ExportSnapshot.getBalancedSplits(files, 5);
155     assertEquals(5, splits.size());
156     assertEquals(Arrays.asList(new Path("file-20"), new Path("file-11"),
157       new Path("file-10"), new Path("file-1"), new Path("file-0")), splits.get(0));
158     assertEquals(Arrays.asList(new Path("file-19"), new Path("file-12"),
159       new Path("file-9"), new Path("file-2")), splits.get(1));
160     assertEquals(Arrays.asList(new Path("file-18"), new Path("file-13"),
161       new Path("file-8"), new Path("file-3")), splits.get(2));
162     assertEquals(Arrays.asList(new Path("file-17"), new Path("file-14"),
163       new Path("file-7"), new Path("file-4")), splits.get(3));
164     assertEquals(Arrays.asList(new Path("file-16"), new Path("file-15"),
165       new Path("file-6"), new Path("file-5")), splits.get(4));
166   }

189   /**
190    * Mock a snapshot with files in the archive dir,
191    * two regions, and one reference file.
192    */
193   @Test
194   public void testSnapshotWithRefsExportFileSystemState() throws Exception {
195     Configuration conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();
196 
197     final TableName tableWithRefsName =
198         TableName.valueOf("tableWithRefs");
199     final String snapshotName = "tableWithRefs";
200     final String TEST_FAMILY = Bytes.toString(FAMILY);
201     final String TEST_HFILE = "abc";
202 
203     final SnapshotDescription sd = SnapshotDescription.newBuilder()
204         .setName(snapshotName)
205         .setTable(tableWithRefsName.getNameAsString()).build();
206 
207     FileSystem fs = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster().getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
208     Path rootDir = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster().getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
209     Path archiveDir = new Path(rootDir, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
210 
211     // First region, simple with one plain hfile.
212     HRegionInfo hri = new HRegionInfo(tableWithRefsName);
213     HRegionFileSystem r0fs = HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(conf,
214       fs, FSUtils.getTableDir(archiveDir, hri.getTable()), hri);
215     Path storeFile = new Path(rootDir, TEST_HFILE);
216     FSDataOutputStream out = fs.create(storeFile);
217     out.write(Bytes.toBytes("Test Data"));
218     out.close();
219     r0fs.commitStoreFile(TEST_FAMILY, storeFile);
220 
221     // Second region, used to test the split case.
222     // This region contains a reference to the hfile in the first region.
223     hri = new HRegionInfo(tableWithRefsName);
224     HRegionFileSystem r1fs = HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(conf,
225       fs, new Path(archiveDir, hri.getTable().getNameAsString()), hri);
226     storeFile = new Path(rootDir, TEST_HFILE + '.' + r0fs.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
227     out = fs.create(storeFile);
228     out.write(Bytes.toBytes("Test Data"));
229     out.close();
230     r1fs.commitStoreFile(TEST_FAMILY, storeFile);
231 
232     Path tableDir = FSUtils.getTableDir(archiveDir, tableWithRefsName);
233     Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, rootDir);
234     FileUtil.copy(fs, tableDir, fs, snapshotDir, false, conf);
235     SnapshotDescriptionUtils.writeSnapshotInfo(sd, snapshotDir, fs);
236 
237     testExportFileSystemState(tableWithRefsName, Bytes.toBytes(snapshotName), 2);
238   }

240   private void testExportFileSystemState(final TableName tableName, final byte[] snapshotName,
241       int filesExpected) throws Exception {
242     Path copyDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir("export-" + System.currentTimeMillis());
243     testExportFileSystemState(tableName, snapshotName, filesExpected, copyDir, false);
244     removeExportDir(copyDir);
245   }

247   /**
248    * Test ExportSnapshot
249    */
250   private void testExportFileSystemState(final TableName tableName, final byte[] snapshotName,
251       int filesExpected, Path copyDir, boolean overwrite) throws Exception {
252     URI hdfsUri = FileSystem.get(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration()).getUri();
253     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(copyDir.toUri(), new Configuration());
254     copyDir = copyDir.makeQualified(fs);
255 
256     List<String> opts = new ArrayList<String>();
257     opts.add("-snapshot");
258     opts.add(Bytes.toString(snapshotName));
259     opts.add("-copy-to");
260     opts.add(copyDir.toString());
261     if (overwrite) opts.add("-overwrite");
262 
263     // Export Snapshot
264     int res = ExportSnapshot.innerMain(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(),
265         opts.toArray(new String[opts.size()]));
266     assertEquals(0, res);
267 
268     // Verify File-System state
269     FileStatus[] rootFiles = fs.listStatus(copyDir);
270     assertEquals(filesExpected, rootFiles.length);
271     for (FileStatus fileStatus: rootFiles) {
272       String name = fileStatus.getPath().getName();
273       assertTrue(fileStatus.isDir());
274       assertTrue(name.equals(HConstants.SNAPSHOT_DIR_NAME) ||
275                  name.equals(HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY));
276     }
277 
278     // compare the snapshot metadata and verify the hfiles
279     final FileSystem hdfs = FileSystem.get(hdfsUri, TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
280     final Path snapshotDir = new Path(HConstants.SNAPSHOT_DIR_NAME, Bytes.toString(snapshotName));
281     verifySnapshot(hdfs, new Path(TEST_UTIL.getDefaultRootDirPath(), snapshotDir),
282         fs, new Path(copyDir, snapshotDir));
283     verifyArchive(fs, copyDir, tableName, Bytes.toString(snapshotName));
284     FSUtils.logFileSystemState(hdfs, snapshotDir, LOG);
285   }

303   /*
304    * Execute the ExportSnapshot job injecting failures
305    */
306   private int runExportAndInjectFailures(final byte[] snapshotName, boolean retry)
307       throws Exception {
308     Path copyDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir("export-" + System.currentTimeMillis());
309     URI hdfsUri = FileSystem.get(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration()).getUri();
310     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(copyDir.toUri(), new Configuration());
311     copyDir = copyDir.makeQualified(fs);
312 
313     Configuration conf = new Configuration(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
314     conf.setBoolean(ExportSnapshot.CONF_TEST_FAILURE, true);
315     conf.setBoolean(ExportSnapshot.CONF_TEST_RETRY, retry);
316 
317     // Export Snapshot
318     int res = ExportSnapshot.innerMain(conf, new String[] {
319       "-snapshot", Bytes.toString(snapshotName),
320       "-copy-to", copyDir.toString()
321     });
322     return res;
323   }

325   /*
326    * verify if the snapshot folder on file-system 1 match the one on file-system 2
327    */
328   private void verifySnapshot(final FileSystem fs1, final Path root1,
329       final FileSystem fs2, final Path root2) throws IOException {
330     Set<String> s = new HashSet<String>();
331     assertEquals(listFiles(fs1, root1, root1), listFiles(fs2, root2, root2));
332   }
333 
334   /*
335    * Verify if the files exists
336    */
337   private void verifyArchive(final FileSystem fs, final Path rootDir,
338       final TableName tableName, final String snapshotName) throws IOException {
339     final Path exportedSnapshot = new Path(rootDir,
340       new Path(HConstants.SNAPSHOT_DIR_NAME, snapshotName));
341     final Path exportedArchive = new Path(rootDir, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
342     LOG.debug(listFiles(fs, exportedArchive, exportedArchive));
343     SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitReferencedFiles(fs, exportedSnapshot,
344         new SnapshotReferenceUtil.FileVisitor() {
345         public void storeFile (final String region, final String family, final String hfile)
346             throws IOException {
347           verifyNonEmptyFile(new Path(exportedArchive,
348             new Path(FSUtils.getTableDir(new Path("./"), tableName),
349                 new Path(region, new Path(family, hfile)))));
350         }
351 
352         public void recoveredEdits (final String region, final String logfile)
353             throws IOException {
354           verifyNonEmptyFile(new Path(exportedSnapshot,
355             new Path(tableName.getNameAsString(), new Path(region, logfile))));
356         }
357 
358         public void logFile (final String server, final String logfile)
359             throws IOException {
360           verifyNonEmptyFile(new Path(exportedSnapshot, new Path(server, logfile)));
361         }
362 
363         private void verifyNonEmptyFile(final Path path) throws IOException {
364           assertTrue(path + " should exists", fs.exists(path));
365           assertTrue(path + " should not be empty", fs.getFileStatus(path).getLen() > 0);
366         }
367     });
368   }
369 
370   private Set<String> listFiles(final FileSystem fs, final Path root, final Path dir)
371       throws IOException {
372     Set<String> files = new HashSet<String>();
373     int rootPrefix = root.toString().length();
374     FileStatus[] list = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, dir);
375     if (list != null) {
376       for (FileStatus fstat: list) {
377         LOG.debug(fstat.getPath());
378         if (fstat.isDir()) {
379           files.addAll(listFiles(fs, root, fstat.getPath()));
380         } else {
381           files.add(fstat.getPath().toString().substring(rootPrefix));
382         }
383       }
384     }
385     return files;
386   }
387 
388   private void removeExportDir(final Path path) throws IOException {
389     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(path.toUri(), new Configuration());
390     FSUtils.logFileSystemState(fs, path, LOG);
391     fs.delete(path, true);
392   }
